summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated May 8, 2018. It designates Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as successor executor, and bequeaths his entire estate to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The individual creating the will, a resident of St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, who directs the distribution of his estate to a trust.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed by Epstein as one of the primary executors of his will, to be compensated $250,000 upon completion of probate.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Appointed by Epstein as one of the primary executors of his will, to be compensated $250,000 upon completion of probate.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Named as the successor executor if either primary executor fails to qualify, is unable or unwilling to serve, or ceases to act.

connections.description: Epstein appointed Indyke as an executor of his will, indicating a formal legal and fiduciary relationship.
Epstein appointed Kahn as an executor of his will, indicating a formal legal and fiduciary relationship.
Epstein named Ruemmler as the successor executor of his will, indicating a planned legal and fiduciary relationship.
Both were appointed as co-executors of Epstein's will, indicating a shared professional role and responsibility.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement for The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust was executed, into which Epstein's entire estate is to be transferred upon his death.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament leaves his entire estate to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust, dated May 8, 2018.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as the primary executors of his will, each to be paid $250,000 upon completion of probate.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is named as the successor executor if either primary executor cannot serve.
Epstein declared himself a resident and domiciliary of St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands.
